interfaces
Interface ContactManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
ContactManagerImpl
public interface ContactManager

A class to manage your contacts and meetings.

Method Summary

Method Detail

addFutureMeeting

int addFutureMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts,
                     java.util.Calendar date)
Add a new meeting to be held in the future.

Parameters:
contacts - a list of contacts that will participate in the meeting
date - the date on which the meeting will take place
Returns:
the ID for the meeting
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the meeting is set for a time in the past, of if any contact is unknown / non-existent

getPastMeeting

PastMeeting getPastMeeting(int id)
Returns the PAST meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none.

Parameters:
id - the ID for the meeting
Returns:
the meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a meeting with that ID happening in the future

getFutureMeeting

FutureMeeting getFutureMeeting(int id)
Returns the FUTURE meeting with the requested ID, or null if there is none.

Parameters:
id - the ID for the meeting
Returns:
the meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a meeting with that ID happening in the past

getMeeting

Meeting getMeeting(int id)
Returns the meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none.

Parameters:
id - the ID for the meeting
Returns:
the meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none.

getFutureMeetingList

java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(Contact contact)
Returns the list of future meetings scheduled with this contact. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.

Parameters:
contact - one of the user’s contacts
Returns:
the list of future meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the contact does not exist

getFutureMeetingList

java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(java.util.Calendar date)
Returns the list of meetings that are scheduled for, or that took place on, the specified date If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.

Parameters:
date - the date
Returns:
the list of meetings

getPastMeetingList

java.util.List<PastMeeting> getPastMeetingList(Contact contact)
Returns the list of past meetings in which this contact has participated. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.

Parameters:
contact - one of the user’s contacts
Returns:
the list of future meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the contact does not exist

addNewPastMeeting

void addNewPastMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts,
                       java.util.Calendar date,
                       java.lang.String text)
Create a new record for a meeting that took place in the past.

Parameters:
contacts - a list of participants
date - the date on which the meeting took place
text - messages to be added about the meeting.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the list of contacts is empty, or any of the contacts does not exist
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null

addMeetingNotes

void addMeetingNotes(int id,
                     java.lang.String text)
Add notes to a meeting. This method is used when a future meeting takes place, and is then converted to a past meeting (with notes). It can be also used to add notes to a past meeting at a later date.

Parameters:
id - the ID of the meeting
text - messages to be added about the meeting.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the meeting does not exist
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the meeting is set for a date in the future
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the notes are null

addNewContact

void addNewContact(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String notes)
Create a new contact with the specified name and notes.

Parameters:
name - the name of the contact.
notes - notes to be added about the contact.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the name or the notes are null

getContacts

java.util.Set<Contact> getContacts(int... ids)
Returns a list containing the contacts that correspond to the IDs.

Parameters:
ids - an arbitrary number of contact IDs
Returns:
a list containing the contacts that correspond to the IDs.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the IDs does not correspond to a real contact

getContacts

java.util.Set<Contact> getContacts(java.lang.String name)
Returns a list with the contacts whose name contains that string.

Parameters:
name - the string to search for
Returns:
a list with the contacts whose name contains that string.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the parameter is null

flush

void flush()
Save all data to disk. This method must be executed when the program is closed and when/if the user requests it.
